I noticed he served no one water unless they asked (we were no exception and even then we only received one water... To share?  It's 100 degrees out).  He was nice enough until we started asking for things... Like water, or an extra ramekin of ketchup).  After we got our food he never stopped to ask if everything was okay or if we needed anything extra.  The food:  started with the garlic spread.  The bread was actually very good, if very salty, the spread was meh.  They do split entrees for $2 extra and you can then have two separate full sized sides.  We opted for 3 sliders, cx/tri tip/burger with fries and tri tip spicy Mac n cheese sides.  The sliders were dry, the meat tough.  The tri tip was begging for au jus, the burger spongy and over cooked (tasted old).  The chicken was moist at least but very little flavor.  Mac and cheese was... Mac and cheese.  (Go to people pizza pub a 1/2 mile away for good Mac n cheese).  Fries were basic, too many of them, and served with only 1/2 a ramekin of ketchup.  Would come back here for a beer and pop corn, but that's it.

wNIoxSUaY2J4eddpliKK1w.text: I love the orange beer. tastes like orange cicles. the mac and cheese is top notch and the sliders are good. James the bartender is one of the better ones in the state. and the beer in general is on point.

ho69p9jDL8RQoT2p5_kOSw.text: Really a nice place, near downtown, with a great menu and a fine beer list. Not pretentious, just good food and great atmosphere where you can have a romantic, or business or casual dinner with friends or family. Interesting folks at the bar to strike up a conversation with or a quiet corner to read and get a little work done. I have done it all, there.   Thanxxxxxxxx  Julie

ssm00TcNPIRf-BdkqvKViA.text: Everything about Mother Bunch is top notch.  They have a unique beer selection.  You can try their brews, such as the Sorachi Ace Pale.  They also have a nice variety of local beers, such as from Huss.  The atmosphere is laid back with a variety of different seating options.  James the bartender is always friendly and remembers your order if you come in as often as I do.  The food is the best part though.  I am not normally one to order a burger, but I cannot resist theirs, with or without the pork belly.  The wings also have a subtle touch of sweetness that works just right.  I cannot recommend this place enough, this is my new favorite happy hour spot!

wIkN4k9QvUzKCZV3gDA60g.text: A must-visit restaurant in Phoenix!  Although I'm not a beer drinker, the food has been excellent each time we've visited (5 times!).  We've found the menu provides choices for every taste. They smoke their own meats (Delicious!), including turkey & chicken (I don't eat beef or pork).  Their smoked olives are phenomenal, warm, smokey bites of heaven.  Love the servers there - Joey (like the baby kangaroo) is particularly memorable, friendly, attentive and entertaining. We'll visit Mother Bunch often (even though we live in the NW Valley) and take friends there often!

7_lYCXtF7iGyYGWB-2vGPg.text: Solid beer list and knowledgeable staff.  I didn't try the food, but looks promising.

OggwNgESpOB4fgOp-4p7zQ.text: omg...this was such a great lunch experience.  Casual, trendy, hip, inexpensive and absolutely delicious!  The western burger was super moist and flavorful and the side of mashed potatoes was sublime!  Fast lunch service and the waiter was super nice and seemed very knowledgeable about the large beer selection.  Sadly, I went on Xmas eve and I was working so the beer will have to wait until the next time.  Boozing on the clock doesn't go over well in corporate America!  We need to relaxe like the Europeans.  Booze, food and naps!  I will be going back here very soon.  My only complaint was they were playing cheesy Xmas music which was unexpected from the vibe of the brew pub!

AyLtFcmrslBhB3n8vA-MIg.text: Great place.  Service is top notch and food is right up there as well. Have been there a few times now for both brunch and for lunch and neither one is a disappointment. Their meats are all smoked in house and are bursting with flavor. Their bloody Mary's which are at a great price are not made with a pre made mix. The ingredients are made fresh each weekend. They have a decent list of beers and a bar tender who is super knowledgeable and will gladly help you pick the right drink for you. This place is great and we will be going back again and again.

9AloNdzduxKqHP7IgmhS_Q.text: Cool building. Lots of beer options. On the drink menu, The Ginger was tasty. Ordered the PBBLT, I thought the fried pork belly would be a little too rich but it was perfect! Beer mac was yummy! Service was good. My dude had the sriracha mac n cheese and loved it.

3FEXf9S7E_k4qDQUkOx4BQ.text: We've been watching this place the past few months and eagerly anticipating its opening.  We stopped in with some friends this weekend to grab a drink and some dinner.  They have a great, local beer selection and the food was great too!  I tried the sweet potato and black bean burger with a side of beer mac...yummy!  Everyone was happy with their beer and their food, so we'll definitely be back!

vQfcH3bHqMPOqGXVBDPh_w.text: This place is amazing! Local art on the wall, awesome beer selection (both their own and other breweries), and great food! Had the chiliquiles-- They might be the best thing I've ate in months! Brunch included a 10oz beer with the food! Service was on point as well! Fabulous overall experience!

l5rzdFSQeQK-8zY2QmJ_NQ.text: Great beer, amazing chicken wings, and really good environment. The staff is also very friendly. This place adds so much to the downtown scene.

tTFZVK-GKk4K2-OmInjnJg.text: Amazing food!!!  "Everything is homemade but the bread and the ketchup" and it tasted like it. I want to come back just for the pickles and Mac and cheese.  Service was great and we even had our kids with us (they had the cheeseburger sliders). Took a peek at their brunch menu and need to come back for that too. Not a negative comment to be made.

CNL52mSb8fQqgJN6fH-c4A.text: Really solid addition to AZ microbrewery pubs. Cool warehouse hip setting. Tasty and creative brews (Lost Highway dark IPA was the best for me - flight is definitely the way to go). Burgers are insanely big and delicious. I did the western and could only get through 90% before feeling dangerously full. Great flavorful fresh ingredients and a very good/ big juicy Pattie. You'll be a mess  - but love each bite. The beer cheese Mac is also terrific. When I'm downtown looking for a beer/ meal this place will be high up on my list of solidly reliable bite-brews.

mBZfzXjj7TO_GAd1M2S_YQ.text: I like the bar area, but the one big wall on the left is just too white for me. It was also pretty expensive compared to a lot of the other bars in the area. Thought there would be more local brews and a better variety, especially for the price.

mt0FZ3b8aEBzaYSw3eI3xA.text: Usually enjoy Mother Bunch fine, but tonight we sat down and not one single server approached us after 20 minutes. Needlessly to say, we will not be returning and management needs to address this issue with the staff.

_Rly0NqtZpO9ZeZQIoO9Ig.text: Was in on the evening of March 28. Took the family so there were six of us and we were promptly seated. Our server greeted us quickly and we ordered our first beers and entrees at the same time. Beers were delivered shortly after and were VERY GOOD. Our food came soon after and was amazing all around, Reuben, American Burger etc were all top notch. Unfortunately the service just kind of fell off after that. We all would have ordered a few more beers had our server come back around. Seemed like the place was very understaffed. Only saw three servers and a very hard working bartender. No host unfortunately. One woman with very red hair seemed to be working as well but did not look very happy about it until she apparently clocked out and sat at the bar. She proceeded to sit at the bar with a gentleman and order drinks while completely ignoring at least three parties that came to the door. We watched as two of the parties gave up and left while we wondered where our own server had gone lamenting the fact that several of the beers looked tasty and as stated we all would have purchased more if we had only been given the opportunity. We eventually managed to flag the girl down and get our bill, left our bare minimum 15% and left. The visit started strong as the establishment does have very good food and beer, and just really ended poorly due to very slow/minimal service from our server and the fact that we watched other employees flat out ignoring customers at the door. I suppose good help is truly hard to find these days.

R29fky0lTRk5JUpirTCk7Q.text: We hit this place on a Saturday afternoon, good beer selection for sure, but the service at the bar was not great, bartender forgot by beer order completely I had to reorder and the girl behind the bar was more interested in just putting glasses away, from time to time she would engage an actual customer, guys you need to fix your service issues, it's not that tough. I had the tuna melt, too much smoke and it was not tuna salad it was a filet of tuna, not bad but unexpected. My squeeze had the rueben and it was tasty. Bartenders are calling it in, ( had to wait 5 minutes for silverware and a napkin) more focus there and this place could be on the edge of special.

yTmyPdfv9bwIsfmQyEV-rA.text: They have a large variety of beer to chose from. The breakfast specials even include a beer! The smoke chicken wings are also delicious!

PSijgZaY7_Faabkw-w-eQQ.text: We are so happy this place is in our neighborhood. We recommend cozying up at the bar. The bartenders are always welcoming and you have the TVS if you want to watch the game. So happy they have a lot of their beer on tap now.

DC3EhMajkcPG4vR_N6P43w.text: We live right down the street from this establishment. Unfortunately, I can't say that that is a positive thing. The food and beer are pretty good but it doesn't excuse the lack of customer service. There is a particular bartender there that needs to change her ways. Every time we've gone this female bartender is off standish and rude. My boyfriend suggested an idea regarding the infusion of the drinks and she got really defensive and awkward.  I have worked in many restaurants in the past and I understand it gets busy, hectic and sometimes you may just being having an "off day."  But it had not been busy when she served us as she was talking to a customer/friend right at the bar. Is it really that hard to be nice and put a smile on your face and lose your "I'm too good for you" hipster attitude? I couldn't believe her demeanor. And not just this time, it has been every time we come in. IT IS YOUR JOB TO BE NICE TO PEOPLE AND BE PERSONABLE. If you can't do that you shouldn't work in this industry. Mother Bunch you should recheck your employees service skills. Remember knowledge on drinks and timely delivery is one thing but to be kind and make a customer feel welcomed and comfortable is salient. It is imperative to a successful business.

iETRV5JVPVj9thMrYnFJDg.text: Great Beer, Great Food & Great Ambiance! Love this place and the owner is super friendly.

C0FsVYPJRzpSoWRI4wJWSg.text: AMAZING food, exceptional service, awesome ambience. Seriously considering moving to Phoenix so I can go here everyday!!!! Definitely order the pancakes, life changing.

k-TjqLRo2soNrlTMcJhrnQ.text: There's, shockingly, a lot of bad reviews on here. Looks like mostly service, to which I would reply, we rarely see a new face. The staff isn't very large, it's just not that big of a business yet, so I guess in lieu of what other's are saying, go on a night you have some spare patience. Or maybe a good conversation to preoccupy you in case you don't get the fabulous service I'm always afforded when I go. We regularly frequent this place, James the bartender is wonderful, food is ALWAYS killer, and they have a nice selection of beers. I'm not the biggest fan of their brewing, but honestly, its an over-saturated market so I'm a fan of any place with something unique on tap (And they don't overstock IPAs, a near impossibility to find these days). I could rave for days about this place, it's by far my favorite brewery in the valley!

s9oJwUJdQBkaf-rvDdR-Aw.text: Went there tonight.... Music just right ... Clean and comfortable!   Excellent service and our food was wonderful!   We WILL be back.... Our new "take everyone" place to go!

ZBWODPXzyY7PUulJcCfbPw.text: Awesome beer selection with super helpful staff. Joey was awesome at recommending things to try.

QF7h7JHykcFtCV6JbJyHpA.text: I love this place. Love it. Great beer selection (seriously, thank you for having a local brewery tap list that only has one Four Peaks beer on it. AZ has a lot of great breweries and no one else seems to get that), love the mac and cheese, love the PBBLT. Chef came around and visited and explained they focus on fresh ingredients...salad dressings, pickled items, etc. are all made in house. Service was a tad slow but I can't fault them for that considering they've just opened. Plus, the servers were all enthusiastic about the product and the place in general, so that more than makes up for it.

jK2iquIn-Cqy6yp5LkrHpw.text: Great cheese and meat platter and with over 20 beers on tap you can not go wrong.  Beers range from Wit  to Nitro Caramel Cream.  All beers I tasted were very good.  One year anniversary keep it up.

k4Vc4Rn8NRyobU9l3JgTVA.text: Made a reservation for six of us for hubby's birthday. Our friend took ill and unable to join us. Felt badly that I reserved a large table for our group but hostess was accommodating and said it was no problem. Sweet! We were seated at long table on pew like benches near the kitchen. We marveled at how quiet and composed the kitchen was. Impressive. We ordered bread and garlic spread and bacon popcorn apps for the group. Hubby and son enjoyed the Sierra Nevada IPA, sis and I had the Creamsicle Shandy, bro in law had a stout. All very cold and oh so yummy. Hubby devoured the Mother of All burgers and said it was absolute perfection with good quality beef. Bro in law and I each ordered the Bayless Brown. He ordered sweet mashed potatoes for his side and I had original mashed for mine. He practically licked his plate clean. I ate half of mine and had the leftovers today. Just as yummy the second day. Son had the western burger and he ate every delicious nibble. Sister had the Balsamic Bleu burger. She raved about its gooey goodness. All the burger eaters got generous portions of crispy and salty fries on the side. The table shared brownie and vanilla bean ice cream and Pear and Apple crumble with vanilla bean ice cream. Server MaryLynn was attentive and made great suggestions. We will add to our list of must visit again!

zkSQgPAYL1aNggMniFA2tQ.text: They have pretty good beer! Loved the atmosphere and will most likely be coming back to try out some more beers. I love breweries!

1PKX6eCF6wAjSIhKfZnXeg.text: I have been waiting with much anticipation for Mother Bunch to open, and am very happy to say they are a great addition to the downtown/Roosevelt area. I went with the husband yesterday for a pint and some wings. Upon entering, you can see that they put a lot of work into making this an open and neat looking space. The bar is in the center with tables all around it (including large tables that have church pews as the benches.... awesome!). They have many beers on tap, mostly local, all craft brews. Our waitress was very nice and helpful, she could see I was waffling on which beer to order and offered to bring a sample of the beer I was debating on. Not only did she bring the sample of the requested beer, but also a sample of another beer she thought I might like... how nice is that? I ended up getting the Deer Lord, which I have never had before, and liked it very much. The husband had the Scottsdale Blonde (and he liked that, ha). We received our wings quickly and it was a huge pile of wings. They had a good ratio of drumstick to wing (I don't know about you, but most everyone I know prefers the drumsticks and when a restaurant only gives you one or two, that can be a problem). The flavor of the wings was good, very different than most, very smokey. I do wish they had the same flavor but with added spiciness... they needed more kick in my opinion. Other than that, they were good. The waitress also sold me on the apple cake with salted caramel gelato and beer infused whipped cream (I'll admit, it was an easy sell). She told me it was one of her personal top 5 desserts in Phoenix. When it came out, the sheer size of this slice was daunting. It was a BIG piece of cake. But it was really delicious.... and we ate the whole thing.... we're pigs. It is a slice of an almost caramelized tasting cake with slices of apples on top, which was decent on its own, BUT when paired with the incredible gelato, it was a real winner. The gelato was fantastic, went well with the cake, and even had some bits of chocolate in it (which always helps). The beer whipped cream didn't taste too beer -y, but was delicious cuz... whipped cream...you know. Overall, the dessert was pretty fabulous. I would come back just for the dessert, but I would also like to try their other food items and their beer (once it's made available!). Will be back!  Update: I have been back twice - once for brunch and once for beer and mac and cheese. The brunch was fair, but we went on the first day they served it - I'm sure it will be wonderful once the kinks are worked out. It is a great deal though, 10-12$ for a meal and a beer or mimosa.... awesome! I got to try their house brew Saison, which was delicious.... it had a lot of spices in it, but was still light. The real star here, though, (other than the dessert) was the beer mac.... OH MAH Gawd...... That is some of the most delicious mac I have had in Phoenix. It has the perfect amount of beer flavor. I want to come back and just eat beer mac forever (ha). The price is also reasonable (8$), especially for the size of the portion. I will reiterate, will be back!

Z9gUKPn6A7JQc8akyfvm4g.text: This spot is a great addition to the downtown Phoenix food-o-sphere. Particular points of pride are their combined selection of in-house and craft beers. The servers are really quick AND friendly, and the restaurant's artwork is a rotating selection of pieces for pleasure and sale. (When I was there, they had these cool little animated-looking critters.)  Now that we've covered the general positives, it's time to discuss something important. The Veggie Hot Pot. This is the best vegetarian pub food I have ever had, and frankly, it trumps a lot of vegetarian dishes you'll find at established veggie eateries like True Food and Green. I don't mean that as a slam to those places, but this dish is just something special if you're a little bit over turning down "protein" in your salad, getting the mac and cheese or hoping for a vegetarian soup to go with your squash sandwich. No no.  For starters, the Veggie Hot Pot is hearty. It's warm. It's filling. It's flavorful. It combines nutrient-dense, seasonal foods into a chunky tomato-based sauce and gives you some polenta for dipping. Fiber. Vitamins. Carbs. It's a simple meal, don't get me wrong, but it's the ideal of a plant-based meal. It's a plant-based meal you can drink on. A rare find and a choice feature of the menu at Mother Bunch. Kudos!

XDuCmVxzegV2hAJTm65u7Q.text: I have been to Mother Bunch twice now - once to check it out for an upcoming group brunch and once for the group brunch.  The first time I went I sat at the bar and ordered the biscuits and gravy. The staff at the bar seemed very attentive and they kept checking in with me ... Then the owner sat next to me and they seemed to forget about me. All checking stopped so I just decided I would never get a drink refill and I just need to finish and leave. But the biscuits and gravy were fabulous!  Fast forward a few weeks to my group brunch. Hardly anyone else was there at 11:00am but by noon there were a lot more people there (still plenty of tables though). I ordered the French toast and it was also fabulous and original (bread pudding for breakfast). But the server was great and he kept checking on us and 8 separate checks went off without a hitch.  I don't drink so I can't rate the alcohol but my boyfriend is a craft beer drinker so I look for breweries with good food (very rare). I found it at Mother Bunch (also at Prison Hill Brewery in Yuma).

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their special for the day (huevo rancheros)
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The French toast was obviously wonderful! It was gone.
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their version of French toast (described as bread pudding the apples)

CzBe3jp_AGH_M6mER8kKRw.text: For the grown, sexy and comfortable. This spot is really a surprise punch from the blindside. My preconceived notions were spanked.   The Roosevelt Row & Garfield Districts are known for their budding artistry, medical/journalism students and hipster vibes but I'm all about solid quality and value. Trendy chic is kid stuff. I want to spend my money and time in the company of people who can deliver what I need.   I need great food. They deliver. Big. Mashed potatoes, a simple side dish that'll make your panties drop. Steaks? Burgers? Chicken? Yes, yes, and hell yeah. The kitchen don't play.  I need great service. They've hired the best team in Phoenix, hands down. The chef is a goddess. The servers and bar staff bring their A-game with charm. I have reason to suspect that for the owners and managers, Mother Bunch is a labor of love. Chili's and Applebee's can't compete with real artisans who love their craft.  I need a bar that's in it to win me, not my wallet.   Oh, Mother Bunch, we'll be seeing a lot of each other.

PrsdA9DA9lm-ju3BW_TGvQ.text: My family came here for Fathers Day and had a great experience.  In fact, it may have been the perfect place for that.  The prices are really good - very fair prices for what we thought was outstanding food and drinks.  All of the beer was excellent - we drank mostly the Saison de peche (peach) and the two IPAs.  They offer 4, 10, 16 and 32oz sizes, so you can try many of the beers.  But it was the food that we will go back for - we had appetizers of bacon popcorn, smoked wings, garlic spread and baked cheese puffs, all of which were delicious.  For entrees we had the biscuits and gravy which were AWESOME, and the tri-tip eggs Benedict with sriacha hollandaise which were also fantastic.  We had both breakfast sandwiches - the regular and the Brewers Sandwich.  The regular one was good, but those who had the Brewers sandwich (with peanut butter, jelly and pork belly) said it may have been the best breakfast sandwich they have ever eaten.  Last we had the French toast and the chilequiles.  The French toast is like nothing you've ever had - it really is more of an apple bread pudding with fruit and whipped cream and it rocks.  The chilequiles were really different.  Tons and tons of flavor, I personally loved them.  They were a bit salty for other peoples tastes, and although I liked them, I would agree with this opinion.  The restaurant was really busy, so I'm giving the service a bit of a pass.  Super friendly, but a few missed orders and some very long waits for beer refills.  But all in all, this is our new favorite place for brunch.  As an aside - although we did not order lunch, we watched it go by, and it looked AMAZING.  The burgers were absolutely huge.

i9pZ59LHAD1rAA9FmwlDCQ.text: Had a delicious brunch here this am. Husband is not much of an IPA guy so the scottsdale blonde was suggested and he enjoyed it. I had sangria which was tasty. Our meals were Turkey bacon Benedict on homemade biscuits with green chili hollidaise sauce and the biscuits with schiners local sausage and beer gravy. Pleased with both. Great space in historic Garfield district building. Supports local artist with shows as well. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d1EPBzWr-YgzNwWRklCKLQ.text: So here is the good and the bad;  The Good: The food. Although I have not had any entrees, but my girlfriend said everything she had was absolutely amazing. I myself have had the happy hour Mac n Cheese Trio; which was great a month ago but we did honestly get an iffy order the other day. The loaded french fries where also awesome (add the tri-tip, amazing).  The beer selection is also a plus. Don't know if it's an on going thing, but all twenty taps were local Arizona breweries. We finally tried their own beers too. I thought the Pale Ale was their best, as the Cherry Porter was only slightly cherry-ish. The Goze was also one of the most unique beers I've ever tried; something like a soughdough bread beer.   The Bad: First off parking sucks, but then again, everywhere in downtown Phoenix has bad parking. Either the tiny lot is full or reserved for valet. Anyway, while the food is good, it is a bit on the pricey side and I feel breweries are more of a casual hangout spot so it's hard to throw down $15 to $18 for an entree on top of beers. Also, I love Happy Hour and I was surprised to find a bar & brewery that doesn't have beer on Happy Hour? Only sides & apps.   Overall; great beer selection, great appetizers, no beer happy hour and slightly higher priced meals. We would definitely go back, but probably for a group event (as there is a lot of space) or special occasion like a birthday.

oAJzYkzN9bBeIck3vmq8Ew.text: Downtown destination. Carnivore? You must get the Phx French dip or the amazing Roosevelt Reuben, yeah duck pastrami baby. Melt in your mouth amazement. Have a date that enjoys a vegetarian meal. Well you're covered with an amazing sweet potato & black bean burger. The beer list is fantastic although they are not brewing yet. Most of the system is in and hopefully we'll get a taste of Mother Bunch Beer soon. Parking is a little tight so do the urban thing , and walk, bike, hike or bus it in. Decor is very comfortable and welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome!

gDFbI6Fu1es7BvCSMiU20A.text: The atmosphere here is great.  Good mixed crowd which means that the place isn't catering to only one type of customer.  The servers are cheerful and knowledgable and on my first visit the chef even came and checked in on our food which is always a big plus.    Overall, the beer selection is quite good - theres a nice range to choose from.  I found a lot of the ales to be on the sweet side but thats a personal taste issue.  Overall, the food is better than average - great salads and burgers.

S9b-ODcgHqYi3BEbJEO24g.text: Had a lunch meeting here last week, really good service, burger was ok - not great overall. But it was a cute spot, I'd go back and try a few other menu items for sure another time.

TaroiI4vm4a-GYQHnKRErA.text: Great beer selection, huge food portions. Come hungry, come thirsty. Very cool place to enjoy super craft beers!

Zzr5DHO8cOW4pVGTkJGVYg.text: Second time here - gad the wings, disappointing, bartender service disappointing! The bartender flirted with her friend from another bAr the entire evening. She pored drinks for everyone except me - which made me wonder why - and she was all in all just completely unprofessional

UDzWz8fGuR1vbfcdVqzm4Q.text: My fiance works next door at the wedding floral shop, Tabletops Etc, and we've been waiting anxiously for Mother Bunch to open and we were not disappointed!   First off, as avid proponents of historic preservation, they did an amazing job with the building. Big windows to the street, the cool oval bar and a window in back peeking into the kitchen, it's perfect!   The food is fantastic, and quite a step above usual bare fare. Since MBB is staking their name on their beer it may have been tempting to skimp on food quality but they certainly didn't. I had the delicious pork chops which came with some or the best mashed potatoes I've ever had.  As for the drinks, I'm a teetotaler so I stuck to their cream soda which was very thick, rich and delightful. My fiancee had a few cocktails I can't recall the names of, but gave them a big thumbs up. The beer drinkers at our table were very much looking forward to returning once MBB has their own beer ready to go.  MBB is EXACTLY the type of business downtown Phoenix needs lots more of and I hope you'll support it. Keep in mind it's brand new so kinks like parking, service time, etc are still likely being ironed out. I have a feeling MBB is going to become a major area landmark and really help connect Garfield with Roosevelt Row and Evans Churchill.

6nd6UQ8T7mRTHnvR2v197Q.text: I really like the menu and ever changing beer selection.  The chef is very creative and I love that everything pairs well with BEER!  Staff is friendly.  The only thing I'd like to change is the lack of information on the beers (no IBUs, alcohol %).  The reason I'm interfere in this information is to be responsible.  I might have two Porters instead of one, but that depends on the percent alcohol.  Not knowing that makes me have to just have one and leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly slider with add bacon.  Amazing!

g4xy08GV4gUrPIIOgaMxfQ.text: The Downtowner was hella good! I can honestly say it's one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten! I got the pale ale mashed potatoes too... Wow!

m15kvxUjmJFE2OAWK3nxog.text: We celebrated my birthday at MBB and enjoyed a fabulous time. I had the seared tuna salad and was most pleased. Friendly servers, fantastic host and just a wonderful time for all! We also tried out the usual fare like the Mother hamburger, French Dip and Mac and cheese and we're happy with everything we ate.  Our adult kids bragged on the micro-beers to polish off a great celebration!

bWBr6vUOPH_TM6keYH8CwA.text: The once industrial building is now a great eatery. We wondered in here on a Sunday morning about 11. Desiree greeted us at the bar. I wanted a cool refreshing cocktail and Desiree recommend the cucumber collins (three of those went down the hatch while we were there, nope I wasn't driving!). Next we had the Bacon Popcorn - say what!!! Yes, popcorn made in bacon grease, seasoned and topped with super crispy bacon bits. Drooling just thinking about it. Next we saw they offered French Onion Soup, my tall person has to try this where ever it's offered, I shrugged my shoulders, meh. Man, was I completely WRONG! This little crock came out topped with melty cheese and mountain of chopped green onions - the soup was to die for! Sweet onion flavor with soft cooked onions the broth wasn't overly salty (AMEN!) came with a couple of slices of toast also covered in melty cheese. There was a bit of a shoving match for the last couple of spoons of soup. Finally we gave a the cheese and meat board a try. All the feels for this one! Mother Bunch, we'll be seeing you again, real soon - that's a promising threat!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Onion Soup should be called French AMAZING Soup!
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Popcorn.... has ruined movie popcorn.
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mother Bunch... damn right!

9o79S9LlP7zSfgwMp5cOrA.text: It's great to see so many fantastic local restaurants and bars popping up all over the Valley. Mother Bunch is no exception to this excellent crop of new hangouts.  I stopped in on a Sunday night with a big group of friends for a birthday celebration - the shared table had plenty of room, and the reclaimed church pews used for seating were comfy and spacious. The music selection was great, and the atmosphere was cozy. I had the tuna melt, which is one of my favorite dishes and unfortunately not found often in gastropubs. It had a great balance of crispy and juicy and was served at the perfect temperature (hard to do with cold tuna salad/hot pressed sandwiches), with a great medley of flavors and what tasted like house-made rye bread. The side garden salad was not skimpy, and very filling. I also tried the orange blossom beer, which had mandarin orange notes which were very light and complementary and did not keep the beer from tasting like... well, beer.  The service was undoubtedly the best part. Our server, Zane, had a keen sense of timing and was very organized with our group of 9, and other servers assigned to different sections were quick to help out with any of our needs. After we had left to our next destination, I could not find my wallet, and called Mother Bunch to see if anyone had seen it. Julie, the owner, took the time to look around where we were sitting, the rest of the restaurant, and outside, to no avail. I had to catch a flight back to Chicago in the next two days, so I was a little panicked and went back to the restaurant to check myself just to ease my mind. Julie and Zane assisted me in checking out the restaurant again, moving couches and furniture, as well as outside, and the parking lot. Zane even went through the trash with me to make sure it wasn't accidentally thrown out.   After another search of the parking lot, Zane suggested we look through my car together, "even though it's probably been done a thousand times, just to be safe," where my wallet was snugly tucked between the console and the backseat.  Cue swear words, and the creation of a lifelong Mother Bunch fan. I'll be there every time I'm in Phoenix!

tGJNHMgtLD7LAEwnJMegUA.text: I can't say that I've anything bad here. MB has amazing food and a wide variety of local beer selections! So, I have had the turkey Benedict, the chilaquiles, the mac and cheese trio, wings, fries, and the brownie dessert. ALL OF IT WAS GOOD. Also, if you're going in for brunch time, they have a brunch and mimosa (or beer) special and it's great! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey Benedict

Hhl6mIMlZpPNHKFecUZvQQ.text: So I came here because I was headed to another Phoenix staple and did not want to wait outside for an hour.  Surprise this place was good. My server was quick and nice. I had Tri Tip Eggs Benedict with a bloody mary.   The bloody mary was really good and the EB were ok. There holindaise was just ok. It needed more lemon or something.   I got a fresh pot of coffee and man it was good coffee. I would come back if I was over here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tri Tip Eggs Benedict

dfZeg4Wi8ax1LWK6PwqoPw.text: Mother Bunch Brewing was the place picked for November's Breakfast Club UYE, I had been excited to try this place out, I was one of the many in the valley waiting for Mother Bunch to open there doors. We were very surprised to find out when we arrived it was in fact the very 1st weekend of debuting their bunch menu.  Let's start with the place, it's a great space, I love the pews they have as seats for the long tables, like the openness of the bar. This place just makes you feel at home. Like I said it was the debut of the brunch menu and boy did they have plenty to choose from and great deals.  Each deal comes with a choice of  drafted beer, mimosa,  bloody mary, sangria for either 10 bucks or 12 bucks, depending on what dish you order, I think that's a bangin good deal!  I went with the Tri Tip Eggs benedicts with a sriracha hollandaise sauce, home potatoes and a mimosa for 12 bucks!  The eggs benedicts was delish, the sauce was great just wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be, but ask for a side of sriracha and you can fix that for sure! The home potatoes were a perfect side for this dish!  They do not have a child's menu, but they do make exceptions, I did have my 1  1/2 yr old grandson with me and for him I ordered an egg, home potatoes and orange juice for a total of 6 bucks, WHAT?? Man he ate like a king too, it was supposed to be one egg scrambled (eggs are what he likes) but it was a huge plate of scrambled eggs, he demolished too!   Mother Bunch is a great place for breakfast, very excited to have tried the menu and look forward to coming back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tri tip eggs benedict

uNbmyahVh9OqVG-JduiV2A.text: We had some mixed results over here near the stadium. As for beer, the Cherry Porter had a great smell, but then the cherry taste really wasn't that present. It was good that you could pay either $2 or $4 to sample the beer because a full glass would have been a waste of money for that beer. The other people at my table enjoyed their lunch. A mixed veggie platter with polenta and the sweet potato veggie patty were well received. My burger though had major issues. They drenched the bun in odd tasting garlic mayo and the meat was poor quality. I would skip the burgers and try another item, but the chicken was not white meat either, so this might be a better place for Vegan's.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bad burger
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie fest

dt52UKCFsSlrhdy6XcMB1A.text: A solid 3.5 that gets rounded up to 4. The beer selection is not really all that extensive as I would like but most certainly generous. I did enjoy most of their beers esp their own brews. The sampler for the beers is a delightful way to try more of the beers without having to commit to a whole pint.   The atmosphere is enjoyable and our server was definitely affable and made excellent recommendations for our food choices. The food choices could use more vegetarian options but even then I liked the place enough to wish I lived a little bit closer. There is definitely something about the place that I enjoy. So why dock that one star. They were out of the Saison when we went back and while things like that do happen I think I expected more when you call yourself a place that prides itself on your beers. Also some of the seating options make you feel like you are in detention and in real estate parlance would be called cozy at best.. But hey even so I've been here more times than I want to admit.. Heck i think I may head on down now!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cJVEcagR4gXinVnrNslMmQ.text: I never give 2 stars review, because I believe that restaurants deserve a second chance. However, I will not come back to Mother Bunch Brewing for quite a long time, or not at all.  It's too bad, I actually bookmarked this place a few months back and was very excited to try it.   My husband and I decided to give it a try on our day off, we drove all the way to Downtown Phoenix. The restaurant itself is quite nice, nice decoration, nice feeling. We were greeted at the entrance by a waitress, but we actually decided to sit at the bar. That was our mistake .....  I understand that we can have bad days (I am a waitress myself), however not smiling to your customers, not being enthusiastic, not even talking or caring is not acceptable. If you do not want to work, don't work!   I got the Lunch Special, 10oz beer, half tuna sandwich and fries for $10 (that's the first star I give them) Being in Downtown Phoenix, this is a really good price. The other star they get is for their beer. My husband and I love beer, and the three that we tried were very good! I got the Raspberry Gose, very nice! not too bitter, perfect for a 10oz pour. My husband got a pilsner and an IPA, I cant remember the names.   Regarding the food, I can't even give them a star for it .. We both for the tuna salad sandwich and honestly we weren't even sure it was tuna .. The fries were good but I'm wondering if they were homemade. My husband got the mashed potato and it tasted like straight buttermilk..  Overall, our experience was mediocre. The only positive thing is their beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch Spécial, tuna sandwich -

ZGq6N6cB9hS2vthMbozLtg.text: Food - over priced and not good! !!  Beer - wonderful!   15 bucks for a cheesesteak that had re heated meat ( you  can just tell, you know it has that certain taste) - sad!  Beer is very good. With many different selections including sours   Total hipster establishment.   Stick to the beer!

1GEgIqmbn17LLU4ItqDxUQ.text: Craft beer lovers, come here!!   They have 20 house beers, so Awesome!  I had an amazing flight, loved 3/4: 1. And the beet goes on- light with sweet aromas 2. Cherry popping porter- Think cherry coke with a coffee finish. So cool! 3. Mounds stout- soooo good! The coconut is noticeable at the end. Think stout with coconut, awesome! 4. Nitro oatmeal milk stout- tasted flat, I know nitro makes it smooth, but I expected a little more bite.   Loaded fries were surprisingly good, piled high with an incredible house made mustard.   Mac and cheese was really thick and artificial tasting. Noodles were thick and slightly undercooked.   Veggies and polenta had a peculiar taste. Ordered it on the fly, couldn't eat more than a few bites. Flavors were weird. Sorry I'm lacking better descriptions with this one.   3 alarm black bean burger was really good.   Service was good. Bathrooms are clean. Cool beer making instruction wall in the back. Tv's playing sports. Large enough for big groups. And the late 90s early 2000s music playlist was fire.

Ohn5tQ7U8bWsTBgNRezXjw.text: I stumbled upon this place (not literally, I hadn't had a beer yet!) on a sunny Phoenix day. As I sat down amongst a wide range of clientele, I was promptly greeted by the nice bartender.   He gave me two tastes before I settled on their house IPA. It was very different but delicious. The aftertaste was smoky and all kinds of weird that make for a good, unique beer.   I did not get the chance to get any food because I was just stopping in for a quick one, but I will definitely be back. It seemed like they had quite a few vegan/vegetarian options which I am always a fan of.   My favorite part of my little stop here was that I was able to meet a lovely friend! She was much like me; a young 20-something just wanting good craft beer. I highly recommend stopping in here if you are just by yourself. It's not one of those places that you'd feel weird sitting alone at. You'd just enjoy the atmosphere.   I bought a growler to go for my boyfriend and my tab was under $20! Hard to find with these craft breweries charging asinine rates for growler fills.

cPW07_rov35kZBllRH4FvQ.text: This is a really nice spot. The service was very prompt and friendly and we really enjoyed the beer and food. They had a nice variety of beer on tap (about 12 beers of their own along with a couple other options from different breweries). We ordered the piggy bank pulled pork sandwich and it was incredible. It was literally the best pulled pork sandwich I've ever eaten. Would definitely come back!

TY9HlZV31FE6CbWc7TI4lA.text: A brand new brewery opened in town recently. I saw some check ins on Untappd and remember seeing the construction a couple of months ago. I stopped in on my way home from work and it was not busy - only a couple of customers.   The building was very spacious and had a nice exposed brick that gave it a cool warehouse feel. The bar had plenty of seating and there were tables that should give the brewery plenty of room on what I imagine will be busy weekends. Just down the street from Chase Field and US Airways it is in a great location to pick up pre and post-game drinks.  They have four of their own beers:  Mother's Gose, Aramis Pale, Oatmeal Stout, and the Cherry Popper. I had a flight of the four, and each was good. The Aramis had a hint or orange and the cherry was not overpowering in the Cherry Popper. They also have a nice selection of local beers from Huss, College Street, Papago, Grand Canyon, San Tan, Dragoon, Sonoran, and Lumberyard. It was a nice surprise to also see Ninkasi on tap because it is new to Arizona distribution just in the last couple of weeks. I was also impressed by the prices. All beers were the same price! 4 oz flight class $2, 10 oz $6, 16 oz $8, and a 32oz growler for $10. Say what? $10?  It was a nice place and I am glad to see another location for good local craft beer. They have food too, but I didn't check that out this visit. Next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mr-QgcJ0VazjydM35KdroA.text: This is a fantastic restaurant!! The most amazing Mac and cheese and French onion soup!! The burger portion is huuuuge!!

qmNPQRRiXVX5WX-am62VaQ.text: Arizona Restaurant Week is one of the best times of the year !!! Mother Bunch was on my radar.  The fresh berry salad was delightful, light and paired with the perfect blueberry dressing . Second course - mahi mahi, corn , quinoa and black bean salsa with a green goddess dressing AMAZING!!   My partner in crime pretty much wanted to marry the chicken cordon blue if it was single.  Third course chocolate brownie with vanilla bean gelato . Heaven on a plate !!   Oh yeah a 16oz of their own beer AND wine accompaniment!   Thank you for a great experience.  The service was impecable as well.

yc8n6eamtnpDT12qb1Vv9A.text: let me start with - I will return.  Great spot! Started with 7th street sliders, which were wonderful.  Get the mac n cheese! Service was wow! Everyone was nice.  I was introduced to the brewer, who stayed near for questions! I tried, so far,  9 beers! All were what they should be or different in a great way.  Fun stuff here! Cool note: their Dutch treat reminded me of what Stella Artios used to taste like before it was ruined by AB!  Come to enjoy the beer and food

unmbqWxducWVsID1dPYMsQ.text: The Good:  -Location, location, location -hostess sweet & quick -bar staff helpful & patient -20 AZ beers on tap  The Bad: -nada bad to say at all. :)  We bellied up on a Sunday Funday to the bar & had a couple of brews. The Sonoran White Chocolate & Papago Brewing Coconut Joe both faves in my book. So we loved both & had a Meyer Lemon Cocktail $9 completely tasty but on the smaller side portion wise.  We had eaten as we didn't know the Mother Bunch was open yet so my review is based solely on the bar experience but the eats looked delish & can't wait to sink my teeth into a few of the items I saw on the menu. Olives & bread, Salmon plate, garlic dip, sliders, wings etc etc etc. Also can't wait for the brew master to get to brewing so I can try the Mother Bunch brews. I'm crossing everything that the Cherry is gonna be as good as it sounds & that there is a PUMPKIN porter.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders- chicken, hamburger &amp; grilled cheese

kAET48xSGRco0fPbU3KgxA.text: Always good food and tasty beer. Unlike other micro brewerys in town, their beer has unique profiles and distinct tastes. Adding more hops doesn't make better beer. This place is worth a stop.

e60imIcf-ET0ohTSEo0Fog.text: Underwhelming interior and rushed service. We went undecided on brunch or lunch; neither of us had been there before. We perused the menu on our phones before we went and quite a bit looks interesting. When we arrived everything was great. I expected a rush being Sunday, but it was quite quiet for noon. We decided to get drinks first. Just barely now looking over the drink menu the waitress comes over and asks if we are ready. The minor in our group says yes and orders food. We felt awkward and rushed to order something as well. I ordered the bacon stuffed pancakes. Very delicious, but extremely heavy and hard to finish. My other half orders the plain pancakes. He says they are very underwhelming and need salt. To top it off the muddled raspberry in the mimosa are so hard to drink through. Everyone likes muddled fruit, but it just seemed excessive. I tried finishing it off as we left but physically couldn't. I'm torn if I wanna go back to try lunch.

filUPg0OgIg8E70_P8DDbw.text: Beer selection is awesome and constantly changing. If you are in the mood for a great brewery this is it. Food is not good though so don't expect anything beyond the beer

RDGbwb1BjQGRC7HRe2Dt0g.text: Very good beer and very good food, in a cool space. They just need some ceiling fans.   The bacon popcorn is cool, not sure if it's worth it, the cheesy poofs are fun, the roasted garlic spread was nothing original but I really liked it, and the burgers were quite good.  I found the service good and the staff friendly.

ALflRuVnhU7kJR7xTUqxaA.text: Took me forever to try this place because it was so far from home. Finally did and kicked myself for not trying it sooner. The place was very eclectic and the people were awesome. The food was incredible and the presentation was even better. This is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baked french toast

G_z-IRpbJvm2UGlyJocUiA.text: It's been forever since my fiance and I have been to Mother Bunch (we went once before like two years ago), so randomly, we decided to go back for dinner. The first time we went it was just to have beer and their Bacon Popcorn, so I had no idea how big their food menu is!   We came for dinner on a Friday night around 6:30p, so I was happily surprised that it wasn't super crowded here (I was hungry lol), and we were seated right away. Our waitress was super friendly, though it did seem like it took a long time to get our beer each time we ordered. Our food came out really fast though!   Since it had been a long time, we started with a flight and tried the Stay Tru Pilsner, the Summer Chamo, the Pink Boots Smart Blonde, and the Urban Decay. We didn't love all of these, but I'm glad we did a flight so we could try a lot of their beers! I love that they offer four different sizes ranging from $4-$10, it's so perfect for trying as much or as little as you want.   For dinner, I had the Smoked Wings, which were really good but hotter than I expected! We still liked them a lot though; if you like the smokey taste I recommend them. My fiance had the MB Cheesesteak, which he really liked as well. There were a tonnn of jalepenos though, so watch out for that! And the fries were delicious :)   Definitely glad we decided to come back, I for sure want to come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. MB Cheesesteak
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smoked Wings

uBvUYJLjFj_Ikq7QajmRAw.text: Great beer Mac and cheese. Lots of varieties of tasty beers, which change often (from what it seems).  They have wonderful, huge, decadent burgers. One order is more than plenty for two to split or have leftovers. The service was very friendly. I asked for no onions on one part of my order, so they intuitively put onions on the side for me for another part of my order in case I felt similarly, which I really appreciated. Fun spot!

ODRZnVi8HVb0T3JawKhMSQ.text: Good vegan and veggie options. We loved the Veggie Hot Pot, which was misnamed but it was a very tasty bowl of steaming hot veggies, with a side of cornbread-style polenta "bread" with poppy seeds. I also loved that they sell 4oz beers individually, for when you want to taste one a la carte, or when you don't want much to drink. The impatient server lost them a atar from my rating: he rushed every single conversation and even told us at one point that he was too busy right now to take another drink order, even though it was Sunday and the place was mostly empty. Overall a good experience, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 4oz porter is just right!
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Hot Pot

lEmWZjWWw-_Eaberv-F3EQ.text: The Western burger is the best burger I've ever had. Their portions are huge. Service is great.

5ZuSPsff4MYCqJBJi6jRFQ.text: Came here with a coworker to check it out.  We ordered a beer flight as well as the Pretzel Sticks and Loaded Potato Skins to share.  Can. I. Just. Say.  The potato skins are gob-smacking good, I'm drooling now just writing about them.  None of that pre-made frozen little skins here, this was a whole halved potato LOADED with all of the fixins including so much melted cheese! The beer options are varied and good and the scene is unique to boot!  Where else are you going to find an exposed brick wall in Phoenix?  Bravo Mother Bunch for creating something that gives your patrons yummy food AND a unique experience!

wL7NkL-vC5e0LzxVtqUKTQ.text: Mother Bunch is that solid spot that took me a few visits to really appreciate. I'm not a beer guy and with beer being a major part of their business, I didn't really give it a fair shake my first time out. I was dragged here on a couple of occasions before I ever stayed long enough to order food and suddenly my eyes were opened to the full spectrum of just what MB has to offer.   They have a full menu of burgers, sandwiches, mac n cheese, wings, salads, ruben, cheese steaks and that's just a small part of what you'll find. There's about 20 different beers on tap here, most of them brewed in house and some traveling guest brews from another spot in town or close by.  Now I love coming here for a meal, grab an appetizer, and yes, sometimes have a beer. Their portion sizes are nice and splitting a plate will cost you an extra dollar or two but it will come with one side per plate, totally worth it to share that awesome backyard BBQ burger, which is my favorite thing on the menu.  Happy Yelping Phoenix, come experience mother bunch and all the great things they have to offer!

ysOZ2t8hGUOBujIjlvuK2Q.text: What a great find. In town for a couple days and got lucky I spotted this place.  Great service, great food and great beer.  20 beers on top.  I had a flight and all were good.  We got several appetizers and they were all excellent. The dinners were also good. The chef came out to our table to check on how we liked the food.   I will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer menu
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight of beers

S6L2CJJgswoJcSDE-CbxrA.text: Ugh so bummed! I've had this place bookmarked for the longest and finally had a chance to come for my friend's post wedding dress shopping brunch.   Inside is dark and fitting for a brewery. Nothing wowed me decor-wise but I was hoping the food and service would be spectacular. Man did they disappoint.   Whenever I dine out I ask for the server's recommendations and the most popular dishes. She recommended the ahi tuna salad sandwich and it sounded fresh and delicious. Unfortunately when I took the first bite, all I tasted with was a canned tuna fishy flavor - yuck! I rarely ever complain about food or send dishes back. I consider myself a total foodie and I eat and like most things! But this, this concoction had a weird flavor and texture- so much so that I felt like if I continued to eat it, I would get sick.   The worst part: the service. I can understand not liking a dish but I've never really had an experience like this one. The waitress didn't ask how our table's food was so I had to call her over and tell her that I really didn't like the sandwich. I really hate complaining about food and barely ever make a fuss but this sandwich was THAT bad. She was very expressionless and didn't seem to want to get me anything else. Reluctantly she asked. And I said I would just order a grilled cheese instead - because a.) I didn't want to have to wait too long for a new order because I was famished and b.) my thought was there is no way one can really mess up a grilled cheese. Right? Wrong! Omg first of all she left the sandwich at the table and never removed the plate. The fishy smell prevailed but at least I could eat the fries. Second, it took longer than it should have to receive the sandwich. And finally, the "grilled cheese" - if you could even call it that - had virtually no cheese. It was more like grilled bread (see pic). I took one bite and gave up on it. Also, important to note, the waitress avoided eye contact after delivering the sandwich and never came back to the table to ask me how it was until she delivered the check. That was intentional. And rude.     The ONLY reason I am giving two stars is because the rest of my party enjoyed their food. A friend shared even one of her chicken lettuce wraps with me and it was actually pretty good.   I probably won't return. I left disappointed in the food and service but at least I had great company, we enjoyed ourselves, and that made this dining experience worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not a fan of the tuna sandwich or the &#34;grilled cheese&#34; with no cheese
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really? This is the inside of my &#34;grilled cheese&#34; ??

2_Jbjv1qLD2XGSnknjxhSg.text: Great brewery! Fab local vodka, gin, beers n wine! Fun place with a great friendly staff! Fabulous food!

gIXs6rKb4TD8IV-jEz6IvQ.text: I ordered the Mother Burger, it was so delicious! I could barely finish my burger though it was HUGE! The food here was so delicious, but their portions are too big. I thought their beer was good, nothing extraordinary though. If I'm back in Phoenix I will definitely be back! The prices we're also very reasonable!

Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mother Burger

fyiLTrt0x44rkmPZtqt2nw.text: Came here for the beer! A nice spot that was quite busy. Amazing beer selection and I was so happy to get there right before they ran out of their glittery beer! I also had a flight of beers which I enjoyed.  I wasn't hungry when I visited, but my dad and I shared the cheese curds. They were nothing special. Everything else on the menu looked good though and I would've liked to visit again to try more.  Overall, a nice venue for good craft beer. (and possibly food too!)

4rUU6ohuiUDWbuXsVCy64Q.text: Never, ever did I think...I'd be able to order an entire bowl of Roasted Garlic Spread!!!! *The pic doesn't do this dish justice* Mother Brunch Brewing had it, did it well and damn, did we eat it.  The place is comfortable, affordable and has a ton of Hand-Crafted Brewskies to drink.  Super fun Vegetarian options throughout the menu.  One of my FAVORITE spots while visiting PHX.  Perks: Prices, Beer Selection, Great Music in the background.  Mother Bunch Brewing - 825 N 7th St Phoenix, Arizona 85006 - 602.368.3580  Eating Out With A Girl #EOWAG #EatingOutWithAGirl

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eating Out With AGirl + BEST Garlic dish, EVER!

_jKUljbHDdt4ubnYZ4hMNQ.text: Pretty relaxed place, I had already ate but the food looked very good! It's a nice brewery though, our waitress was interesting, kind of indifferent but not really unfriendly or unhelpful.  The beers were good and I always like the option of a flight :D

omVRQMejgAHVzUIGPjW3UQ.text: I like this place; I like this place a lot...  The food, service, atmosphere, and beer selections all exceeded my expectations.  This was our first visit and we will definitely be back!    We started with the pork rinds for an appetizer. Did you know pork rinds and salsa go together?!?! Now, you do... The salsa is top notch for a salsa lover!  We concluded with the smoked wings (opted for the house, Mother Bunch, sauce) and the sweet potato black bean burger.  Solid choices, both were good.  I put salsa from the pork rinds on my burger to kick it up a notch, excellent choice.    Beer... we tasted a few and ordered a total of three of the beers we sampled. They have something for everyone taste palette.  Our server, Josh, was very friendly and helpful with the menu - beer selections and food choices.

PcL8jhLHmbOO3LayKe6UVg.text: Meat lovers, Rejoice!!  You wouldn't think I'd say that about a brewery, but their food is a meat lover's paradise.  They do comfort food well at Mother Bunch.  We have been here a handful of times over the years and have always enjoyed the food.  They have improved the quality and variation in their beers over the years.  Hubby enjoyed their hazy IPA and I was a fan of the Oktoberfest beer.  We each chose a side of super cheesy and meaty sriracha tri-tip Mac and cheese with our meals.  It's only $1 extra for a choice of a few types of mac and cheese instead of a regular side.   I ordered the three slider platter with a tri-tip, pulled pork and classic burger slider.  Hubby ordered the western burger.  He was both excited and apprehensive when the burger came because it was not only a huge burger, but there was a hearty slab of tri-tip on top.  It was definitely a handwasher!  It was a little oversauced but had good flavors and plenty of toppings.  I like seeing the note in the corner of their chalkboard menu behind that bar that tells you the last time they cleaned the lines that the beer travels through.  You can always be assured that your beer will be poured fresh and clean!

QXPU3QJwGoVpd1QajZ6rJQ.text: stopped in for a beer. special seemed interesting so got a bite as well.  plopped down at bar, look at current beer selection and went for something light- single blonde  style was spot on and very good.  Buffalo chicken burger was the daily special and did not disappoint. Peeled off one bun ( appreciate a tall burger , just not going to wear it home, lol ) and used fork and knife. seasoned veggies were very good as well.  will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buffalo Chicken Burger with veggies
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Single Blonde

jAWAVvglJ_QmT6EkJijyRQ.text: Mother Bunch Brewing is the best place to come if you are starving and thirsty since they have huge portions of food and copious amounts of beer. NO ONE at my table finished their meal, which was amazing considering we all were hungry and had healthy appetites.   The atmosphere of this place is very cool. Murals on the wall, a large bar in the center and the tables have church pews for the seating. The staff was nice although our server got two of our beer orders wrong. Honestly, I didn't even know until I read the receipt of my beer at the end, but luckily I liked the beer I was brought! I ordered the White Rascal, but was brought the White Chocolate ($6, 16 oz). This was such an interesting beer that actually wasn't as sweet as it sounded but had a unique flavor. The mistake worked out for the best. I ordered the 7th street sliders to eat ($14) which are three huge sliders served on pretzel buns. You can choose from a list which sliders you would like to get so I ordered: the burger which had cheddar, caramelized onion, and thousand island dressing, the smoked tri tip with roasted poblano and pepper jack cheese, and finally the BBQ mole shredded pork with crispy fried onion and white cheddar. The pork was my favorite followed by the burger then the tri tip in last place.   The food and drink was great, service was pretty good and the atmosphere was casual and fun. I would come back next time I am in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer menu
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders

AG9bHieMGto5wvC5HwprVA.text: Just went for AZ restaurant week and it was a great experience. Went with a group so we got to try most of the dishes offered and share. Great service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi mahi with cous cous and panko crusted chicken
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stout brownie with ice cream
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop and baked tofu with cold sobs noodles

qJKN5dA7X1w2VMYcR51XPA.text: Beer and vibe was good. The pate was really salty and the tofu was inedible because of how salty it was. If I went back it would be for a casual beer. If I had to eat there again I would probably only get the basic bar food..

21A7JABSbJeRGkupWCgvpw.text: Went for Brunch this time. Nothing like 10oz of Bending Light and Freakshow at 10am to wash down the Bacon Pancakes. They offer a brunch special with about a dozen food choices that come with your choice of a 10oz from the taps. Be sure to check out the hallway to the bathrooms for a cool mural depicting a diagram of the brewing process. This is one of the best breweries in the Phoenix Area... because it has a large chalkboard selection, is in an old re-use building downtown, it's not pretentious and its owned by a Woman! Go there now... you will love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ptIa-H6Cx3-NHIFLE29Syw.text: Excellent ! Beers were great ! Burger was tasty and messy ! Ambience was cool, casual and comfortable. I will visit again when I'm back in Phoenix.

rtEy3vZJQWvLpCBEiXaVTw.text: Mother Bunch is a breath of fresh air added much needed craft beer and yummy food to roosevelt row. They have literally just opened their doors and already there are very few kinks to work out - that's impressive.   This place is gorgeous, decorated very cleanly and simply with a nice big bar in the middle and plenty of space. We got a tour from the brewer of the brewing space in the back and its really coming along nicely. They hope to have that up in running soon so we all get to try some of the MB Brew. In the interim, they feature 20 all AZ taps that are really great - not just the normal fare that you see around but also some interesting beers. I had a Fresh Hopped IPA (Fresh Magic), a Sour (Citrana), and a Black IPA (Lost Highway) which were all great - it was a little tough to swallow the $6/beer even during happy hour though but overall I was happy. They had some great discount food options to make the happy hour more happy - including a mac and cheese trio and house made pork rinds.   Really cool spot, I recommend checking this out and saying hi to the friendly staff there. I'll be back again for lunch this week!

TgcBTuPUSd8ChPKlRY1-eg.text: It began strong with an awesome host who provided us with details about how and why it is so great to work there.  The atmosphere is wonderful, the "bar" feel is open, light, inviting.  I was so excited.  As an avid beer taster, I was pleased that they brought me a few flavors.  But honestly, the IPA I was looking for, produced by them locally, did not happen.  No hoppy, piney, citrusy bitter beers to be found.  And I double checked.  My brother-in-law claimed that one of them tasted much like the beer he had at the Miller Company tour. I tried three beers: Golden Ticket, Trippel (maybe not an IPA)? and the Cherry Popper porter (spot on-like a chocolate covered maraschino cherry-but alas, I couldn't drink a full pint of that).  I ended up with the Hop Valley, a visiting tap that I later learned was from Springfield, Or. (now that's a hoppy citrusy beer!! satisfied but wishing to drink locally) Thanks for letting them visit!!  The menu was great. I ordered the tofu burger--super tasty, teriyakish.  My sister had the salad with bean burger and her husband the cheese sandwich.  He didn't comment much, but ate everything.  Warning: serving sizes are huge!  Unfortunately, they only had one toilet--ya, one toilet for a big drinking establishment.  Please consider expanding bathrooms area.  Not cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inviting place!
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great selection! Thanks for supporting other taps!
Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great choice of meaty stuff as well as veggie! Thank you!!

ql4jtgc8gaHrqInIpVSTZw.text: I sat at the bar during lunch on Friday. I was fortunate enough to sample the Gose. It was excellent. Also had the porter and stout which were both good. For lunch I had the Rueben which is made with duck pastrami. Absolutely ridiculously good!!!!! Not sure if they sous vide the duck but it was so tender and perfectly cooked. It came with a side bacon Caesar salad which was nice. Also came with (what I assume were) house made pickles. Very nice addition.

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck pastrami Rueben with bacon Caesar salad

DiTXVjKRP18EURxeJAsNzQ.text: Cool bldg & pretty good selection of beer. Food was also pretty good & will return soon.

t7zZBcXR3QwC4CjLtNaJzA.text: Went for restaurant week. The warmed brie with prosciutto and the hangar steak and sesame shrimp were phenomenal! Please add them to your normal menu!

RqdrlbcDDc7fycHy9V-bvg.text: Stopped in here for a quick dinner before seeing the Phoenix Chorale.  Wonderfully funky atmosphere, great food  - especially for sharing - an interesting and delicious selection of beers and the best ginger beer (they brew it themselves) I have ever tasted.  All of the food we ordered - the salmon, the spinach and apple salad, the vegetable pate were so good and so fresh and so well-presented.  The crowning touch was truly great service.  Marco knew the beers, the food menu and the history of the place chapter and verse and his easy-going attitude made for a terrific dining experience.  We will be back!

NWRjY7ug_gYPPlv7jRvs7Q.text: Excellent food and service. Incredible amount of flavor in the garlic dip and smoked olives. Sweet potato black bean burger, with the sirachi Mac n cheese was perfect. Each of the beers we had was worth another visit. Too many unique choices to try in one night. I'll be back with friends the next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Mother Bunch Brewing - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EO0I4hhm78kPO28GTG1elg.text: Decent place to grab a drink and some snacks. I've been for lunch, breakfast, and to chill with apps at the bar. The food is okay pub fare, however, the mac and cheese trio app is delicious (steak and siracha!). Go for the beer and you won't be disappointed.

E6mSbmUAXxLktKk0C16W9g.text: The place was a tad pricey for Arizona, and brought me back to being at a gastropub in California. The wings were average, but my boyfriend's burger was delicious! They made the patty to order as well, so props there. The main reason I went was for the beer and they had a nice list. It was a bit odd that out of the 7 or so beers brewed there, 2 were saisons, and they were O-K. I really did not enjoy the Rose baie. However, the porter I had was great, and had a cherry and rootbeer type tase, which was quite enjoyable. I may be back for some brews soon!

cA9GpkvGUxzMRyN6AYci7g.text: Let me first say that I'm glad to see Mother Bunch chose to call downtown Phoenix home, and having visited on its 4th day in business, I understand that there are still some kinks that need to be worked out.   Also, Mother Bunch didn't have any of its own beers available and said that was still a few weeks away, so I feel like without that component, this review is still a bit incomplete.  That said, here are my first impressions:  THE GOOD --The 20 taps all feature local beer, and an impressive range at that. It also changes throughout the night as one selection runs out and gets replaced, so on a busy night you can choose from 25-30 beers.  --The food was solid; I had the tri-tip sandwich and mac & cheese and was very happy with the meal. Everyone around me seemed to be enjoying their meals as well and I didn't hear a single issue about the food, plus heard numerous compliments on the meat-free options. They definitely didn't overlook the food component of the experience.  --By and large the staff seemed incredibly friendly and energetic as well as knowledgeable about what was on tap and on the menu.  THE THINGS THAT NEED WORK --When I walked in by myself, I was greeted with the all-too-common "just one?" I'm not sure if others find this as demeaning as I do, but I personally hate it. Just say hello/good evening/welcome and leave the quasi-judgment out of it. There will come a point in my life where I will just turn around and leave upon hearing this.  --There's a hanging rack for glasses in the middle of the bar space, which seems to obstruct the chalkboard with the current beers on tap for a number of patrons. As a primarily beer bar, I can't understand why they would want cocktail glasses obstructing the view of the beer menu.  --As a place that prides itself on local beer, I was puzzled to see why they had so many logoed goods from mainstream brands at the bar: Absolut Cosmopolitan shakers, Hendricks Gin napkin holders, Grey Goose bar mats, etc.  --Similarly, I didn't notice that many local spirits, but rather the mainstream selections. I know they want/need to appeal to as wide of a range of people as possible, but it would be nice to see local/craft spirits used for the non-beer drinker that wants a rum & Coke.  --Along the lines of appealing to as many people as possible, having been seated close to a table with a few screeching and rambunctious children, I really wish this was either a 21+ over place or at least 13+ over or something. As the Trappist Monks used to say, nothing ruins a good beer like a noisy child.  --Some parts of the service seemed a bit off as a to-go order attributed to my seat took a few minutes to find its owner (it wasn't mine either) and my dessert was brought out with two spoons for some reason.  --While it's a festive place, I wouldn't mind seeing some noise dampening material added in the ceiling or to the walls to help absorb some stray noise.   Overall, I was impressed by my first trip to Mother Bunch Brewing and look forward to going back to try more of the menu and the MBB beers once they hit the taps. While none of the above things are truly deal breakers, they are the things that will determine how many of my dining dollars end up here and how many end up at other restaurants in increasingly competitive downtown Phoenix .

cCRrrHkIOQmIoMBgWeDl_A.text: great drinks and bartenders are super friendly and helpful! Gave me a lot of suggestions and told us their favorite dishes. The sandwich PBBLT, was OKAY, but my friend's turkey sandwich and cheeseburger looked really awesome. We got a side of veggies that were delicious. Love the open but "local" feel, with an industrial touch :)

PuqwoK2robxTqLznTsvi5Q.text: The food is excellent- decent quality ingredients in tasteful combinations. Wings are my fave. Fries could be fresh cut to match the richness of the sandwiches. Beers- in-house and regionals. Dragoon is my favorite house brew.
